frame.name: Appellations
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame includes words that are used as the <fen>Title</fen>s of individuals. The <fen>Title</fen> is applied to a <fen>Name</fen> (surname or full name) and often designates their rank within a man-made institution. Pairings of Title and Name can be used as vocatives (see Attention_getting), while the Titles may not always be vocative on their own.
<ex>He saluted <fex name="Title"><t>General</t></fex> <fex name="Name">Fightmaster</fex> walking into the room.</ex> <ex>Everyone stood as <fex name="Title">Captain</fex> <fex name="Name">Jack Aubrey</fex> delivered a toast.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The name of the person referred to by a <fen>Title</fen>.
<ex><t>Reverend</t> <fex name="Name">Roberts</fex> wears wrinkled robes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Title
FE.definition:
<def-root>How a person is referred to within an Institution, often denoting their rank or status. Title is always marked on the target.
<ex><fex name="Title"><t>Judge</t></fex> <fex name="Name">Judy</fex> has made her decision.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: officer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the title of an employee of the police force

lexUnit.name: general.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a commissioned officer of the military at the top of the rank structure

lexUnit.name: captain.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a licensed mariner who has the highest rank of command on a vessel
